models.Compound module

class models.Compound.Compound(name: str, molar_mass: float, collection: protocols.Collection.Collection | None, tree: QTreeView, displayer: Displayer)[source]

Bases: QObject

Represent examined Compound

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of Compound.

  • molar_mass (float) – Molar mass of compound in g/mol.

  • collection (Collection | None) – The collection to which it belongs.

  • tree (QTreeView) – Control tree reference. Necessary for expanding tree after creating/removing tree elements.

  • displayer (Displayer) – Object responsible for visualization of Measurements, Fits and TauFits

models.Fit module

class models.Fit.Fit(name: str, df: DataFrame, temp: float, field: float, compound: SettingsSource, collection: protocols.Collection.Collection | None)[source]

Bases: QObject

Represent one fit for Havriliak-Negami model with n-relaxation

Parameters

  • name (str) – Name of fit.

  • df (DataFrame) – Measurement data(processed data from magnetometer).

  • temp (float) – Temperature measured during the measurement.

  • field (float) – Magnetic field strength during measurement.

  • compound (SettingsSource) – Examined compound.

  • collection (Collection | None) – The collection to which it belongs.

Emitted when name change. Contains new name.

Emitted when at least one row in df changed.

Parameters

  • compound (SettingsSource) – Source of boundaries for parameters.

  • nr_of_relaxations (int, optional) – Number of relaxations in Havriliak-Negami model. Defaults to 1.

make_auto_fit(auto: bool = False, next_fit: Self = None)[source]

Solve a nonlinear least-squares problem with bounds on the variables for cost_function().

Parameters

  • auto (bool, optional) – Determines whether fit was explicitly call by user. Defaults to False.

  • next_fit (Self, optional) – Fit to transfer parameters value in case of performing automated fit process for mutiple Fits. Defaults to None.

static model(logFrequency: ndarray, alpha: float, beta: float, tau: float, chi_t: float, chi_s: float) → ndarray[source]

Implemntation of Havriliak-Negami model

Parameters

  • logFrequency (ndarray) – Logarytm of frequency.

  • alpha (float) – Alpha parameter

  • beta (float) – Beta parameter

  • tau (float) – Time of relaxation.

  • chi_t (float) –

  • chi_s (float) –

Returns

Model predictions for each point in domain

models.Parameter module

class models.Parameter.Parameter(name: Literal['alpha', 'beta', 'log10_tau', 'chi_t', 'chi_s'], min: float, max: float, is_blocked: bool = False, is_log: bool = False, is_blocked_on_0: bool = False)[source]

Bases: QObject

Represent single parameter of mathematical model used in fitting proces

Parameters

  • name (PARAMETER_NAME|TAU_PARAMETER_NAME) – Name of parameter. Used for deducting symbol(which is used in UI)_description_

  • min (float) – Minimal boundry of parameter value

  • max (float) – Maximal boundty of parameter value

  • is_blocked (bool, optional) – If set to true will redefine boundares for parameter in fitting proces to the smallest possible(around current parameter value) suported by runtime enviroment. Defaults to False.

  • is_log (bool, optional) – Determines whether user input is interpreted as parameter value or it log10. Defaults to False.

  • is_blocked_on_0 (bool, optional) – If set to true parameter value will be set to the smallest value supported by runtime environment when cost function in calculated. Defaults to False.

value_changed

Emitted when value changed. Contains new value.

Type

PyQt6.QtCore.pyqtSignal

block_state_changed

Emitted when block state change. Contains new state.

Type

PyQt6.QtCore.pyqtSignal

block_0_state_changed

Emitted when block on 0 state change. Contains new state.

Type

PyQt6.QtCore.pyqtSignal

error_changed

Emitted when error value changed. Contains new error value.

Type

PyQt6.QtCore.pyqtSignal

name_to_symbol

Map between parameters names and their symbols

Type

dict[Union[Literal[‘alpha’, ‘beta’, ‘log10_tau’, ‘chi_t’, ‘chi_s’], typing.Literal[‘a_dir’, ‘n_dir’, ‘b1’, ‘b2’, ‘b3’, ‘c_raman’, ‘n_raman’, ‘tau_0’, ‘delta_e’]], str]

update_from_json(j: dict)[source]

From given dictionary recreate saved state

Parameters

j (dict) – Result of self.get_jsonable()

Examaples:
>>> self.set_value(5)
>>> d = self.get_jsonable()
>>> self.set_value(99)
>>> self.update_from_json(d)
>>> print(self.get_value())
5.0

Bases: object
